description:
Build 'Synapse' - a premium AI Platform with a Vercel/Runable inspired dark aesthetic.

Design System:
- Dark mode only with pure black (#000000) background
- Subtle borders using #333
- Glassmorphism effects with backdrop blur
- Font: Geist Mono for headings, Inter for body text
- Accent color: Electric Indigo/Blue gradient

Layout Structure:

1. LEFT SIDEBAR (fixed, ~240px wide):
   - Top: 'Synapse' logo/branding with subtle glow effect
   - Navigation tabs with Lucide React icons:
     - 'Chat' (MessageSquare icon) - selected by default
     - 'Image Studio' (Image icon)
     - 'Motion Lab' (Video icon)
     - 'History' (Clock icon)
     - 'Settings' (Settings icon)
   - Each nav item should have hover states with subtle background
   - Bottom of sidebar: 'Upgrade Plan' button with gradient border/glow effect

2. MAIN CONTENT AREA (Chat Interface as default view):
   
   TOP BAR:
   - Sleek model selector dropdown on the left
   - Show model options with provider logos:
     - 'GPT-4o' with OpenAI logo
     - 'Claude 3.5 Sonnet' with Anthropic logo  
     - 'DeepSeek V3' with DeepSeek logo
   - Dropdown should have glassmorphism styling
   
   CENTER (Empty State):
   - Welcoming text: 'What can I help you create today?'
   - Subtle animation or gradient text effect
   - Maybe suggestion chips below for common actions
   
   BOTTOM (Input Area):
   - Premium input field with dark glass effect
   - Left: Attachment button (Paperclip icon)
   - Right: Voice input icon (Mic icon) and Send button
   - Subtle border glow on focus
   - Placeholder text: 'Message Synapse...'

Overall feel: Premium, minimal, expensive - like a high-end SaaS product. Use subtle gradients, smooth transitions, and refined spacing.

Build the 'Motion Lab' page - a Video Generation Interface that appears when clicking 'Motion Lab' in the sidebar.

**Navigation:**
- Make the sidebar navigation functional - clicking tabs switches the main content view
- 'Chat' shows the current chat interface
- 'Motion Lab' shows the new video generation interface
- Other tabs can show placeholder content for now

**Motion Lab Layout:** Two-column split view

**LEFT PANEL (Controls) - ~40% width:**
1. Prompt Area:
   - Large textarea with placeholder "Describe your video..."
   - Glassmorphism styling matching the chat input
   - Character count indicator

2. Image Upload Section:
   - Dropzone box with dashed border
   - Icon and text "Upload Reference Image"
   - Subtitle "For Image-to-Video generation"
   - Hover effect with border glow

3. Settings Accordion/Collapsible sections:
   - Duration: Slider or toggle buttons for 5s, 10s
   - Aspect Ratio: Selector buttons for 16:9, 9:16, 1:1 with visual previews
   - Motion Scale: Slider from 1 to 10 with labels (Subtle to Dynamic)

4. Generate Button:
   - Large prominent button "Generate Video"
   - Electric blue/indigo gradient
   - Glowing effect on hover
   - Full width of the panel

**RIGHT PANEL (Preview & History) - ~60% width:**
1. Main Video Player:
   - Large placeholder area for video preview
   - Dark background with subtle border
   - Play button overlay in center
   - Shows "Your video will appear here" when empty

2. Recent Generations Grid:
   - Section title "Recent Generations"
   - Grid of 4-6 thumbnail placeholders
   - Each thumbnail has duration badge, hover effect
   - Use dummy/placeholder data

**Style:**
- Same premium dark theme (#000000 background)
- Glassmorphism for both panels
- Consistent with existing Synapse design
- Smooth transitions when switching views

Build the 'Image Studio' page - a specialized Image Generation Interface that appears when clicking 'Image Studio' in the sidebar.

**Layout:** Split View (Left Controls ~35%, Right Gallery ~65%)

**LEFT PANEL (Controls):**

1. Header:
   - "Image Studio" title
   - Subtitle describing the feature

2. Prompt Area:
   - Large textarea with placeholder "Describe your image..."
   - Glassmorphism styling
   - Character count indicator

3. Style Selector (Grid of 4 selectable cards):
   - 'Photorealistic' with Camera icon
   - 'Anime/Manga' with Sparkle icon
   - '3D Render' with Box icon
   - 'Cyberpunk' with Zap icon
   - Cards should be selectable (one at a time)
   - Selected card has glowing border and gradient background
   - 2x2 grid layout

4. Aspect Ratio:
   - Three toggle buttons: 1:1 (Square), 16:9 (Landscape), 9:16 (Portrait)
   - Visual aspect ratio preview icons
   - Selected state with gradient styling

5. Number of Images:
   - Slider from 1 to 4
   - Show current value prominently
   - Labels showing min/max

6. Generate Button:
   - "Generate Images" text
   - Full width, electric blue/indigo gradient
   - Glowing effect on hover
   - Shimmer animation

**RIGHT PANEL (Gallery):**

1. Header with "Gallery" title and image count

2. Masonry Grid (Pinterest-style layout):
   - Use CSS columns or masonry layout
   - Display 8-10 dummy placeholder images
   - Images of varying heights to show masonry effect
   - Use placeholder images (abstract art, nature, tech, portraits, cityscapes)
   - Different aspect ratios mixed together

3. Image Hover Effects:
   - Darken overlay on hover
   - Show action buttons: 'Download' (download icon) and 'Upscale' (expand icon)
   - Smooth fade-in transition
   - Buttons have glassmorphism styling

4. Each image card should have:
   - Rounded corners
   - Subtle border
   - Smooth hover scale effect

**Style:**
- Same premium dark theme (#000000 background)
- Glassmorphism for panels
- Consistent indigo/blue accents
- Smooth animations and transitions

Make the Chat interface fully functional with OpenRouter API integration and streaming.

**1. Backend API Route (`/api/chat`):**
- Create a Next.js API route at `/api/chat`
- Accept POST requests with JSON body: `{ messages, model }`
- Messages format: array of `{ role: 'user' | 'assistant', content: string }`
- Forward requests to `https://openrouter.ai/api/v1/chat/completions`
- Use `OPENROUTER_API_KEY` environment variable for Authorization header (Bearer token)
- Enable streaming responses (stream: true)
- Return the streamed response to the frontend
- Handle errors gracefully

**2. Frontend Chat Integration:**
- Connect the chat input to the `/api/chat` endpoint
- When user submits a message:
  - Add user message to the chat history
  - Show the message in the UI immediately
  - Send request to backend with messages array and selected model
  - Display AI response streaming in real-time (character by character)
  - Add completed response to chat history
- Show loading/typing indicator while waiting for response
- Handle errors and show error messages
- Clear input after sending
- Auto-scroll to latest message

**3. Model Mapping:**
- Map dropdown selection to OpenRouter model IDs:
  - 'GPT-4o' ‚Üí 'openai/gpt-4o'
  - 'Claude 3.5 Sonnet' ‚Üí 'anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet'
  - 'DeepSeek V3' ‚Üí 'deepseek/deepseek-chat'
- Pass the mapped model ID to the API

**4. Chat UI Updates:**
- Display message bubbles for user and assistant
- User messages on the right, assistant on the left
- Different styling for each (user: indigo gradient, assistant: dark glass)
- Show model name/icon next to assistant messages
- Typing indicator with animated dots while streaming
- Markdown rendering for assistant responses (code blocks, bold, etc.)

**5. State Management:**
- Store chat messages in React state
- Persist selected model in state
- Handle empty state vs active conversation

Make the Image Studio functional with OpenRouter image generation API.

**1. Backend API Route (`/api/image`):**
- Create a new API route at `/api/image`
- Accept POST requests with JSON body: `{ prompt, aspectRatio, numImages }`
- Send request to OpenRouter's OpenAI-compatible image endpoint: `https://openrouter.ai/api/v1/images/generations`
- Use model: `black-forest-labs/flux-1-schnell` (important: not DALL-E)
- Use `OPENROUTER_API_KEY` environment variable for Authorization (Bearer token)
- Map aspect ratios to size parameters:
  - 1:1 ‚Üí 1024x1024
  - 16:9 ‚Üí 1024x576 (or similar landscape)
  - 9:16 ‚Üí 576x1024 (or similar portrait)
- Return the generated image URL(s) to the frontend
- Handle errors gracefully with proper error messages

**2. Frontend Image Studio Integration:**
- Connect the "Generate Images" button to `/api/image` endpoint
- When user clicks generate:
  - Validate that prompt is not empty
  - Show loading spinner on the button
  - Disable the button during generation
  - Change button text to "Generating..." with spinner
- On success:
  - Add the new image(s) to the gallery grid at the top
  - Show success feedback
- On error:
  - Show error message to user
  - Re-enable the button

**3. Gallery Updates:**
- Store generated images in React state
- New images appear at the top of the masonry grid
- Each image shows:
  - The actual generated image
  - Hover overlay with Download and Upscale buttons
  - Click to view full size in a modal/lightbox

**4. Lightbox/Modal:**
- When user clicks an image, show it full size in a modal
- Dark overlay background
- Close button (X) in corner
- Click outside to close
- Show the prompt used below the image

Implement a Usage Limit and Paywall system to monetize the app.

**1. Usage Tracking (localStorage):**
- Track `messageCount` for chat messages used
- Track `imageCount` for image generations used
- Store in localStorage so it persists across sessions
- Initialize to 0 if not present
- Increment after each successful API call

**2. Free Tier Limits:**
- Chat Messages: 5 max for free users
- Image Generations: 2 max for free users
- Check limits BEFORE making any API call
- If limit reached, block the action completely

**3. Paywall Modal:**
- Show when user tries to exceed limits
- Block the action - don't allow API call
- Modal Design:
  - Title: "Unlock Unlimited Power üöÄ"
  - Subtitle explaining why they're seeing this
  - Three pricing cards side by side:
    
    **Starter ($5/month):**
    - 50 Chat messages
    - 10 Image generations
    - Basic models
    
    **Pro ($15/month) - Highlighted/Recommended:**
    - Unlimited Chat messages
    - 50 Image generations
    - All AI models
    - Priority support
    
    **Studio ($30/month):**
    - Unlimited everything
    - Video generation (Motion Lab)
    - API access
    - Priority support
    - Early access to new features
  
  - Each card has checkmarks for features
  - "Subscribe" button on each card (dummy - just shows a toast/alert saying "Coming soon")
  - Close button (X) to dismiss modal
  - Premium glassmorphism styling

**4. UI Feedback:**
- Add "Credits" section in the sidebar above the "Upgrade Plan" button
- Show: "3/5 Free messages" and "1/2 Free images"
- Progress bar or visual indicator
- When credits are low (1 remaining), show in orange/warning color
- When credits are exhausted, show in red

**5. Modal Behavior:**
- When paywall appears, blur the background slightly
- Modal should be centered with dark overlay
- Animate in smoothly
- Cannot be bypassed - must close modal to continue
- "Upgrade Plan" button in sidebar also opens this modal

**6. Integration:**
- Wrap the chat send function to check limits first
- Wrap the image generate function to check limits first
- Show appropriate error if limit reached

**Phase 1: Upgrade Image Studio with Reference Image Upload and Image-to-Image mode**

**UI Changes (Left Panel):**

1. Add "Upload Reference Image" section:
   - Drag-and-drop zone for JPG/PNG uploads
   - Shows image preview when uploaded
   - Remove button to clear the image
   - Dashed border, icon, and helpful text
   - Glow effect on hover/drag

2. Add "Mode" toggle below the upload:
   - Two options: "Text-to-Image" (default) and "Image-to-Image"
   - When Image-to-Image is selected, the reference image upload becomes required
   - Visual toggle buttons with icons
   - Text-to-Image uses prompt only
   - Image-to-Image uses prompt + reference image to style/transform the photo

3. Update the prompt placeholder based on mode:
   - Text-to-Image: "Describe your image..."
   - Image-to-Image: "Describe how to transform this image..." or "as a cyberpunk character, anime style, etc."

**Backend Logic (`/api/image`):**

1. Update API to handle file uploads:
   - Accept multipart/form-data
   - Parse image file from the request
   - Also accept prompt, aspectRatio, style, numImages as form fields

2. Image-to-Image processing:
   - If an image is uploaded, use image-to-image generation
   - Use a model that supports img2img (like flux or similar)
   - Send the base64 image along with the prompt
   - Goal: User uploads a selfie, adds prompt "as a cyberpunk character" and gets styled output

3. Keep Text-to-Image working as before when no image is uploaded

**Integration:**
- Paywall still applies (counts as image generation)
- Premium dark UI maintained
- Smooth transitions between modes

**Phase 2: Upgrade Motion Lab with Image-to-Video capabilities**

**UI Changes (Left Panel):**

1. Make "Upload Reference Image" more prominent:
   - Larger dropzone area
   - Label: "Animate Your Photo"
   - Subtitle: "Upload a photo to bring it to life"
   - Icon showing photo-to-video transformation

2. Add "Mode" toggle:
   - Two options: "Text-to-Video" (default) and "Image-to-Video"
   - Visual toggle buttons similar to Image Studio
   - When Image-to-Video is selected:
     - Reference image upload becomes required/highlighted
     - Prompt placeholder changes to "Describe the motion..."
   - When Text-to-Video is selected:
     - Reference image is optional
     - Prompt placeholder: "Describe your video..."

3. Update prompt placeholders based on mode:
   - Text-to-Video: "Describe your video scene..."
   - Image-to-Video: "Describe how to animate this photo..." (e.g., "make them smile and wave")

**Backend Logic (`/api/video`):**

1. Create new API route at `/api/video`:
   - Accept multipart/form-data
   - Fields: prompt, duration, aspectRatio, motionScale, mode, image (optional)

2. Text-to-Video mode:
   - Use a text-to-video model via OpenRouter/Replicate
   - Generate video from prompt only

3. Image-to-Video mode:
   - Use an image-to-video model (Luma, Kling, Runway, or similar)
   - Pass the uploaded image + prompt
   - Generate 5-10 second animation
   - Return video URL to frontend

4. Frontend integration:
   - Show loading state during generation (videos take longer)
   - Display generated video in the preview player on the right
   - Add to recent generations grid
   - Video playback controls

**Integration:**
- Paywall applies: Image-to-Video counts as a generation
- Add video generation tracking to usage context if needed
- Premium dark UI maintained
- Smooth mode switching
